title: Characteristics of an exponential function
text:
Recall that an exponential function with the form $$f(x)=b^x$$, $$b>0$$, where $$b$$ does not equal $$1$$, has these characteristics:
|newline| $$1$$. one-to-one function
$$2$$. horizontal asymptote: $$y$$ $$=$$ $$0$$
$$3$$. domain: $$(-\infty,\infty)$$
$$4$$. range: $$(0,\infty)$$
$$5$$. x-intercept: none
$$6$$. y-intercept: $$(0,1)$$
$$7$$. increasing if $$b$$ > $$1$$
$$8$$. decreasing if $$b$$ < $$1$$

title: Stretching and Compressing the Parent Function
text:
For any factor a > $$0$$, the function $$f(x)={a\left(bight)}^x$$
- is stretched vertically by a factor of a if |a|>1.
- is compressed vertically by a factor of a if |a| <1.
- has a y-intercept of (0,a).
- has a horizontal asymptote at $$y=0$$, a range of $$(0,\infty)$$, and a domain of $$(-\infty,\infty)$$, which are unchanged from the parent function.

title: Finding the domain and range
text: Transforming the parent function will also change the domain and range. It will be helpful to draw a graph to visualize.
